page.title: 13SUMMER WILD FLOWERS (2)
page.content: {There}is an abundance of Summer Wild Flowers on the road between Habbie Ker's Hanging Tree Site and Midlem. {Meadow Crane's Bill}is prolific on the road sides. Different varieties take their name from the fruit which resembles a Crane's bill. {Bloody Crane's Bill}was used to staunch the flow of blood, hence the name. {Yarrow (Achillea)}may be associated with "the Achilles heel" as the juice is injurious to the skin. {Goutweed}was used to soothe rheumatism {Field Scabious}has medical properties e.g. tannin, alkaloid. {Red Clover}is a protein-rich fodder plant. {Ladies Bedstraw}contains rennin and was once used in cheese making.
